instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants?
Output: To predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants,the researchers used visible spectrum and nir spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants was the Inception module for 1-D feature maps in the DeepRWC model.

instruction: What metric was chosen to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants?
Output: The metric chosen to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants was the R-2 value.

instruction: What was the purpose of developing the DeepRWC deep learning model to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants?
Output: The purpose of developing the DeepRWC deep learning model to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants was to predict the relative water content (RWC) of plants directly from mean spectral reflectance.

instruction: How does the performance of the DeepRWC model compare to standard approaches such as partial least squares regression (PLSR) and support vector machine regression (SVR) in predicting the relative water content (RWC) of plants using spectral reflectance signature?
Output: The performance of the DeepRWC model was compared to standard approaches such as partial least squares regression (PLSR) and support vector machine regression (SVR) in predicting the relative water content (RWC) of plants using spectral reflectance signature. The quantitative analysis showed that the DeepRWC model outperformed both PLSR and SVR approaches. It achieved the lowest root mean square error (RMSE) and better R-2 value on all test datasets included in the study. Additionally, the DeepRWC model eliminated the need for any preprocessing or dimensionality reduction, which is required in the case of other standard techniques like PLSR and SVR. These results confirm the ability of the DeepRWC model to better predict the RWC of plants using spectral reflectance signature.
